I think that be what make downtown abbey so addictive the character both below stair and above have depth and passion which keep one come back again and again.this book start very slowly too I almost give up about a third of the way through but about three quarter of the way through , the story do become more interesting the story take place in yorkshire where william and octavia cavendish live at rutherford hall the open chapter deal with a maid in the household who have become pregnant she be find near a river that run by the estate try to kill herself and the servant run to save she what transpire be an ongoing thread throughout the story.octavia cavendish be still a young woman since her husband be considerably old than she be william cavendish marry she for her money even though her family be in trade he need her fortune to renovate the estate he maintain the stricture that the aristocracy live by those stricture be suffocate octavian she have become a shell of the woman she be when she first marry william.william and octavia have a crisis in their marriage and octavia decide to step out of her cage she begin to turn thing on their head by the end of the novel I feel that the ending be very unsatisfying one be leave wonder what will happen to the cavendish family.i do see that there be sequel to this one and I may read that even though this one fall somewhat flat for I this be a three star book that might redeem itself in the sequel

go girl no way . try not to breathe by author holly seddon a fast pace mystery surround a girl in a coma for more than a decade and a journalist try to find out how she get there.the next go girl absolutely not.amy stevenson be a typical teenager until she be brutally attack and leave for dead she survive but be in a coma amy serve as one of the novel narrator and the reader be privy to her private thought and hope to gain clue about she attacker.our other narrator include amy boyfriend at the time of her attack and a journalist alex dale the story unfold as each character lend their own insight on amy attack.this book in my opinion commit the major sin of any mystery novel it leave out all the mystery if your look for twist and turn hide around every page turn it will not happen the story be pretty straight forward from begin to end and the reader easily see what s coming.amys voice could be a strong addition to the story telling but it completely miss the mark most of her narration be irrelevant as she do not realize she s in a coma at all and spend her chapter wonder where people be and why she s sleep so much its a major disappointment to not have amy character be a strong voice most of her chapter could be edit out and not have effect on the outcome of the novel.alex dale be a highly dysfunctional alcoholic she s lose her unborn child husband and job due to her addiction alex be grasp every last straw on a road to redemption and feel a connection to amy and her untold story alex be such an alcoholic that she wear diaper to bed because she black out so completely at night that she wake to have wet the bed yet she s suppose to be able to launch an investigation into a 15 year old case and solve amy case not go to happen.the one redeem quality of the novel be actually the writing for a story that miss its mark its actually well write every novelist have a novel that fail to deliver and I hope this be holly seddon . I would look forward to read another of her work with hope that the story be a well one.try not to breath be buzz about the literary world with a lot of hype in its wake sadly it just do not deliver the character be improbable and unlikable the story have a lot of potential but it never quite make it to the goal of be an interesting and well tell in the end this one land on solidly on the list of book to miss

dilemma . a teenager be brutally attack and sexually assault send shock wave through her affluent community her parent agree to the administration of an experimental drug that be design to wipe the traumatic memory from the girl consciousness naturally this throw a monkey wrench in effort to apprehend the perpetrator and while it seem to work it fail to address cellular and subconscious recall ultimately , it drive the girl to seek to undo the forget event she wind up in the office of a psychiatrist with finger in many pies.despite a promising premise this book be a disappointment the narration be tiring and long wind generally the handling of ptsd and the friendship between jenny the rape victim and sean a veteran and amputee be convince however the story of jenny bickering parent be silly and distract and the omniscient psychiatrist strained belief the story be aggravate from a legal perspective it render jenny useless as a witness and certainly suggest that she lack the inner resource to deal with the trauma that be say it be an intriguing story with interesting psychological issue it be however bogge down by side story and a less than rivet narration

I appreciate spithill for take on the challenge of share his story and recommend this easy read . twotime americas cup win skipper jimmy spithill open the window wide open to his life in the release of chase the cup my america cup journey spithill take we on a trek that explain his character and conviction from his early day around sydney harbor to the consolation beer follow his recent defeat in bermuda.the book be a tale with two half before team oracle and with team oracle.i find spithill to be quite brave in the first half reveal so much about his physical and family trouble he be no silverspooner , and the fight we have see on the race course and interview be well rooted in a bully kid that find solace in the boxing ring and waterfront.his scrappy rise up the rank earn he a lead position when russell count take over the rein of team oracle spithill share the story of these three america cup campaign offer fascinating behindthescene insight during the most disruptive period in the event modern history.spithill also use the book to even the score with critic question authority opine on parenthood and teach the tenet of team while the reporting on his team oracle era come with some bias I believe he fulfil his mission with the book to show how honest effort can be rewarded.i appreciated spithill for take on the challenge of share his story and recommend this easy ready especially to anyone who seek to inspire youth sailor to reach far
